definition: to pull/to stretch/to draw sth out
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to extend/to state/to explain/9th earthly branch: 3-5 p.m., 7th solar month (7th August-7th September), year of the Monkey/ancient Chinese compass point: 240°
old name for Shanghai 上海[Shang4 hai3]/surname Shen
to make noodles by pulling out dough/hand-pulled noodles

sentences.english: The back of your shirt has worked out of your trousers.
sentences.chinese: 你衬衫的后摆已经抻到裤子外边来了。

sentences.english: At first we thought I had hyperextended it but it turned out to be torn cartilage.
sentences.chinese: 一开始我以为只是抻着了，结果是软骨撕裂。

sentences.english: Brushing wet hair can cause stretching and breakage.
sentences.chinese: 梳理湿头发会拉抻头发，造成损伤。

sentences.english: As rabbit held crane's legs, its weight stretched4 crane's legs long.
sentences.chinese: 兔子抓着鹤的双腿，他自身的重量把鹤的腿都抻长了。

sentences.english: I strained my back when I lifted the box.
sentences.chinese: 我抬箱子的时候背抻着了。

sentences.english: You get up and straighten your tie, you walk up to her and pour her a drink.
sentences.chinese: 你站起来抻直自己的领带，走过去为她点了一杯饮料。

sentences.english: The reason is that pitch chain growth due to wear and tear, transmission stuck at a discount off stretch.
sentences.chinese: 其原因是链条节距因磨损增长，传动时打折卡住抻断。

sentences.english: Stretch the clothes before hanging them up to dry.
sentences.chinese: 把衣裳抻一抻再晾起来。

sentences.english: Stretch the clothes before hanging them up to dry.
sentences.chinese: 把衣裳抻一抻再晾起来。

sentences.english: Someone dived his hand into my handbag and made off with my purse.
sentences.chinese: 有人把手抻进我的手提包，偷走了我的钱包。

sentences.english: Perhaps they'll fit you if you stretch them.
sentences.chinese: 你把它们抻一抻，也许就合身了。

sentences.english: Perhaps they'll fit you if you stretch them.
sentences.chinese: 你把它们抻一抻，也许就合身了。

definition: erhua variant of 使勁|使劲[shi3 jin4]
to stretch oneself (on waking or when tired etc)
to hold sth long and run one's hand along it
to smooth or arrange sth using one's fingers/to stroke
variant of 繃|绷[beng1]/variant of 繃|绷[beng3]
to draw tight/to stretch taut/to tack (with thread or pin)/embroidery hoop/woven bed mat
to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
